intro: Pityrodia iphthima, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in native gardens and for erosion control.
